Other.Name: Extermination Squad
Other.Content:
[[Image]]Extermination Squad.png|An Extermination Squad hunting down Cogmind[[/Image]]
Extermination squads are [[0b10]] aligned [[Squad|squads]] that are sent after Cogmind periodically in [[Factory]] (-7) and beyond. Exterminations are sent directly to Cogmind with [[Perfect Tracking]] and cannot easily be shaken. Extermination squads typically consist of 1-3 [[Programmer|Programmers]] based on the floor: 1 [[P-60 Hacker]] on -7 and -6, 1 or 2 [[P-70 Sage|P-70 Sages]] on -5 and -4, and 2 or 3 [[P-80 Master|P-80 Masters]] on -3 to -1. Extermination squads can be both Enumerated and Recalled at [[Terminal|Terminals]].
An alert will indicate whenever an an Extermination squad is dispatched. Additionally, the log will display a message like [[GameText]]ALERT: Rogue bot located, Programmers report to Factory Zone 5B.[[/GameText]]
[[Heading]]Lore[[/Heading]]
[[Lore]]WAR.Sys Records|Extermination Squad[[/Lore]]
[[Heading]]Frequency[[/Heading]]
Extermination squads have a chance of being dispatched by every 250 turns when on most 0b10 maps. The higher the depth, the higher the chance that an Extermination will be sent. If Exterminations fail to be sent 3 times in a row, one will be sent after 1/3 of the average check time. For example, if no Extermination squad is sent for 750 turns, one will be sent in 1/3 of 250 turns, which is 84 turns, or 834 turns total. This means that there are 4 possible combinations of delay between Extermination squads.
The spawn timer can be delayed with [[Spoiler]]the [[RIF]] ability Zone Cloak[[/Spoiler]] or by sealing [[Garrison (Machine)|Garrison Machines]]. Both of these methods stack, and each provides +75 turns to each possible Extermination squad spawn. For example, closing 2 Garrisons while having [[Spoiler]]Zone Cloak 1[[/Spoiler]] will add 225 turns to the 250 turn timer, increasing it up to 475 turns.
The following table showcases possible time periods in between Extermination squads.
[[Table]]# delay sources (e.g. sealed Garrisons)|1st spawn chance|2nd|3rd|Latest possible||0|250|500|750|834||1|325|650|975|1084||2|400|800|1200|1334||3|475|950|1425|1584||4|550|1100|1650|1837[[/Table]]
[[Spoiler]][[Heading]][[Q-Series]][[/Heading]]
[[Image]]Q-Series.png|2 Q-Series coming for Cogmind[[/Image]]
It is possible for Extermination Programmers to be replaced by 1-2 Q-Series instead. This can occur randomly if Cogmind gets scanned by a [[Researcher]] in [[Testing]] or [[Quarantine]]. These Q-Series have customized and randomized loadouts, but will behave in the same way as regular Extermination squads do. This includes heading straight for Cogmind with perfect tracking, and the ability to be recalled at Terminals.[[/Spoiler]]

Other.Name: Farcom
Other.Content:
[[Image]]Farcom Sensors.png|Farcom sensors revealing nearby hostiles[[/Image]]
[[Image]]Farcom.gif|Using the Farcom Aligner machine[[/Image]]
Farcom is one of the major faction [[Alignment|alignments]] available to Cogmind in most runs. Taking Farcom aligns Cogmind with the [[Exiles (Group)]] for the rest of the game. It provides a permanent 18 tile radius sensor for hostile [[0b10]] bots within 0b10 controlled map. This sensor cannot be jammed by [[Watcher|Watchers]] or masked by [[Heavy|Heavies]] unlike standard [[Sensor Arrays]]. The primary limitation of the Farcom sensor is that it doesn't work in any [[Caves]] branches. One other side-effect is that entering specific [[Research]] branches becomes much more dangerous. Occasionally the Exiles may have been abandoned or attacked, and Farcom is not an option in these runs.
[[Heading:2]]Gaining Farcom[[/Heading]]
Taking Farcom can be done in most runs in the [[Exiles (Location)|Exiles]] map off of either -10 or -9 [[Mines]]. After talking to [[EX-BIN]], walk into the Farcom Aligner machine. Cogmind can take up to 1 special vault item (or multiples of the same type). If Cogmind takes more than 1 type of item then the Exiles will notice you stealing when entering [[Factory]] and Farcom will be removed. Also, becoming hostile to the Exiles will result in instantly losing Farcom. If Cogmind takes Farcom, it is not possible to [[Imprint]]: [[Spoiler]]The [[Imprinter]] will be disappointed in Cogmind and warn you to leave right away. Attempting to use the Imprinting machine will result in turning all the bots at [[Zion]] hostile. There are no other alignment restrictions with Farcom.[[/Spoiler]]
[[Heading:2]]Research Branch side-effect[[/Heading]]
When entering -3 Research, the Exiles will send a warning message to Cogmind indicating not to enter Research branches. If Cogmind does anyway, [[Spoiler]]immediately when entering [[Testing]], [[Quarantine]], or [[Section 7]], [[Maximum Security]] will instantly be triggered. Note that this does not include [[Armory]] when it is on -3. The immediate response is machines shut down right after entering the level, 4 [[Sentry]] spawns at each [[Garrison]] and exit, and 6 Assault [[C-30 ARC|ARCs]] sent at Cogmind shortly after. Unless Cogmind is prepared to fight off large waves of enemies or outrun them, these maps should not be entered.[[/Spoiler]]

Other.Name: Game Mechanics
Other.Content: [[List]][[Alert]] - Semi-hidden number that represents Cogmind's perceived threat level. Has dangerous consequences when too high.|[[Corruption]] - Stat that has various negative penalties and can result in death.|[[Energy]] - Stat that is used |[[Heat]] - Stat that can cause overheating side-effects and deaths in non-immune bots.|[[Matter]] - Stat that is used as a resource to attach parts and shoot some types of weapons.[[/List]]

Other.Name: Garrison (Machine)
Other.Content: [[Image]]Assembled Compromised Garrison.png|[[Assembled]] swarming out of a compromised Garrison[[/Image]]

Other.Name: Garrison Squad
Other.Content:
[[Image]]Garrison Squads.png|3 Garrison Squads of Sentries roaming around[[/Image]]
Garrison squads are [[0b10]] aligned [[Squad|squads]] that are dispatched whenever hostilities are reported within a 20 tile radius around a [[Garrison (Machine)]]. This can occur any time an 0b10 bot is attacked and survives to report it or if a Garrison is attacked by Cogmind or an ally. They patrol around the Garrison for about 200 turns, then return back into the Garrison. These squads only have a chance to spawn and are not guaranteed. Garrison squads can be Enumerated at a [[Terminal]].
[[Image]]Garrison Redeploying.png|A Garrison redeploying, unable to deploy squads for 34 turns[[/Image]]
[[Image]]Garrison Transmitting.png|A Garrison transmitting, soon to deploy another squad[[/Image]]
If the Garrison was activated by a nearby non-combat bot reporting an attack like a [[K-01 Serf]], a single squad will be dispatched from the Garrison, and a 100 turn cooldown will occur before the Garrison can dispatch another Garrison squad. If a combat bot reported the attack, three squads will be dispatched from the Garrison. Once is sent immediately, and two more after 100 and 200 turns. A 100 turn cooldown will occur after the third squad is dispatched. If the Garrison was damaged, one squad will be sent out immediately, with two more squads after 25 and 50 turns. A 50 turn cooldown follows in this case. The combat and non-combat bot versions of these squads can be entirely prevented by using [[Transmission Jammers]].
[[Signal Interpreters]] will indicate the timer between dispatches as a red number and the cooldown during which no squads can be dispatched as a yellow number. The Garrison will indicate that it is Transmitting when new squads are soon to arrive, and Redeploying when on cooldown. Keep in mind, the cooldown only prevents the Garrison from dispatching more Garrison squads and does not prevent other squad types like [[Reinforcement Squad|Reinforcements]] and [[Investigation Squad|Investigations]].
[[Heading]]Composition[[/Heading]]
If the Garrison squad was triggered by a non-combat bot reporting an attack or by the Garrison itself being attacked, the Garrison will only send out single [[Sentry|Sentries]] for the squads. If a combat bot reported an attack instead, the following squad compositions are possible:
[[List]]1 [[Brawler]] and 1 [[Duelist]]|1 [[Demolisher]], only if Cogmind has 1 or more allies|1-2 [[Grunt|Grunts]]|1-2 Sentries|2-3 [[Swarmer|Swarmers]][[/List]]

Other.Name: Imprint
Other.Content:
Imprint is one of the major faction [[Alignment|alignments]] available to Cogmind in a run. It closely allies Cogmind with the [[Imprinter]] and with Zionites as a whole, with Cogmind being determined to be the Zionites' savior. Imprinting majorly changes the game, as it disables all standard [[Terminal]] hacks except for limited access Terminal hacking. Instead, there are a new set of imprint-specific hacks that are available at all Terminals. After imprinting, there is a 10 tile "ping" radius on all standard Terminals which will tell Cogmind their location, even through walls. However, if an [[Operator]] is nearby when this happens, the Operator will shut down the Terminal and call for [[Reinforcement Squad|Reinforcements]]. After about 1200-1500 turns on an [[0b10]]-controlled map, the Terminal network will be shut down with an accompanying log [[GameText]]Terminal network compromised, cutting hard line.[[/GameText]]
[[Image]]Zion Imprinting.gif|Using the imprinting machine[[/Image]]
[[Heading:2]]Imprinting[[/Heading]]
Imprinting is performed on the [[Zion]] map by walking into the imprinting machine on the bottom left corner of the map. The UI will turn orange, and the 4 nearby [[Mutant (6)|Mutants]] will turn purple and follow Cogmind around. Imprinting is incompatible with [[RIF]] (Zion becomes hostile when entering), as well as [[Farcom]] (the [[Imprinter]] will get angry with Cogmind due to her dislike of the [[Exiles (Group)|Exiles]]). Imprinting also means that neither [[Revision 17 (Alignment)|Revision 17]] nor [[Warlord]] will ally with Cogmind. The only ways to lose the effects of imprinting are to attack Zion or enter the [[Zion Deep Caves]]. Doing either will retain the orange color and other negative effects of imprinting, but remove the special Terminal interactions. The [[Core Reset Matrix]] does not remove imprinting.
[[Heading]]Special Terminal Hacks[[/Heading]]
There are 2 types of special Terminal hacks, roster and intel.
[[Image]]Imprint Hacks.png|A selection of special Imprint hacks[[/Image]]
[[Heading:2]]Roster Hacks[[/Heading]]
[[Image]]Imprint Summoning.gif|Summoning 2 Zionites with a roster hack[[/Image]]
Roster hacks summon combat allies or special [[Z-Courier]] haulers containing part resupplies. The allies and hauler contents here are depth-dependent and will grow stronger at higher depths. The hauler contents can include [[Prototype Part|Prototypes]] which can be faulty, so having some way to identify prototypes like a [[Component Analysis Suite]] is very useful before equipping. Using a roster hack will destroy the Terminal when the reinforcements are teleported in after a few turns. There are a limited number of roster hacks available on a given map, starting at 2 slots on -6, increasing every floor up to the cap of 6 slots on -2. Roster hacks will occasionally be rerolled, which can add new roster types or reroll existing types. All roster allies summoned will appear as purple uncontrollable allies which contribute to [[Alert]]. The exception is any summonable [[Z-Hero|Z-Heroes]] which appear as pink, but otherwise behave as purple allies.
One thing to keep in mind about roster rallies is that they will not attack enemies unless Cogmind is close and within line of sight. This can be both a bad and good thing. It is often bad when hostiles are hanging just around a corner and the Zionites get stuck trying to get Cogmind back in line of sight and trying to turn around the corner to fight. When stuck in this case, try to get Cogmind's line of sight over the direction the allies are trying to go. However, it may be good if Cogmind doesn't want the roster allies to stick around long and get lots of kills, racking up lots of alert. It is possible to manipulate the bots to not attack back even when they are being attacked while standing around a corner.
If Cogmind is not careful about friendly fire, roster hacks can become temporarily disabled. The length of the lockout can vary depending on the amount of friendly fire. In extreme cases, Cogmind can be locked out for the remainder of the game. Killing imprint allies directly is not recommended for this reason. Instead, it is best to try to allow allies to be killed naturally if their loot is desired
The available ally-summoning roster hacks are as follows:
[[Table]]Type|Depths|Summon||Demo|-6 and -5|1-2 [[Martyr (5)]]|||-4+|1-2 [[Martyr (7)]]||Experimental|-3+|[[Z-Experimental (10)]]||Hacker|-6 and -5|2-3 [[Wizard (5)]]|||-4+|2-3 [[Wizard (7)]]||Fire|-6 and -5|3-4 [[Fireman (5)]]|||-4+|3-4 [[Fireman (7)]]||Heavy|-6 and -5|1-2 [[Z-Heavy (5)]]|||-4 to -3|1-2 [[Z-Heavy (7)]]|||-2 and -1|1-2 [[Z-Heavy (9)]]||Hero|-6+|A random [[Z-Hero]]||Light|-6 and -5|2-3 [[Z-Light (5)]]|||-4 and -3|2-3 [[Z-Light (7)]]|||-2 and -1|2-3 [[Z-Light (9)]]||Recon|-6+|A [[Z-Drone Bay]], not a bot directly[[/Table]]
Resupply rosters are entirely delivered inside a single Z-Courier. The available resupply roster hacks are as follows:
[[Table]]Type|Number of parts|Available parts||Defense Resupply|8|Defensive Utilities including [[Antimissile Systems]], [[Armor]], [[Core Shieldings]], [[Graphene Brace|Graphene Braces]], [[Hardlight Generators]], [[Power Shieldings]], [[Propulsion Shieldings]], [[Resistance Devices]], [[Shield Generators/Force Fields]], [[Utility Shieldings]], and [[Weapon Shieldings]]||Explosive Resupply|2|Explosive [[Launchers]]||Hacking Resupply|2|[[Hackware]]||Heavy Resupply|4|[[Armor]], [[Hcp. Storage Unit|Hcp.]] and [[Huge Storage Unit|Huge Storage Units]], and [[Treads]]||Hover Resupply|8|[[Hover Units]]||Infowar Resupply|4|infowar Utilities including [[0b10 Decoder Chips]], [[Cloaking Devices]], [[ECM Suites]], [[Machine Analyzer]], [[Seismic Detector]], [[Sensor Arrays]], [[Signal Interpreters]], [[Terrain Scanners]], [[Terrain Scan Processors]], [[Transmission Jammers]], [[Trap Scanners]], [[Triangulator]], and [[Visual Processing Units]]||Kinetic Resupply|8|[[Ballistic Cannons]], [[Ballistic Guns]], and offensive Utilities including [[Matter Filters]] and [[Recoil Nullifiers]]||Melee Resupply|4|[[Impact Weapons|Impact]], [[Piercing Weapons|Piercing]], and [[Slashing Weapons|Slashing]] weapons, including unique Derelict weapons like [[Particle Cleaver|Particle Cleavers]] and [[CR-A16's Behemoth Slayer]], as well as offensive Utilities including [[Actuators]], [[Actuator Arrays]], [[Melee Analysis Suites]], and [[Force Boosters]]||Offense Resupply|4|Offensive utilities including [[Armor Integrity Analyzers]], [[Core Analyzers]], [[Launcher Guidance Computers]], [[Kinecellerators]], [[Launcher Loader]], [[Melee Analysis Suites]], [[Particle Chargers]], [[Tactical Coordination Suite]], [[Target Analyzers]], [[Targeting Computers]], [[Weapon Cyclers]], and [[Weapon Mount]]||Resource Resupply|12|Storage or resource-related Utilities, including [[Energy Wells]], [[Field Recycling Units]], [[Matter Compressors]], [[Storage Units]], and [[Tractor Beams]]. All resource-containing utilities will be filled.||Thermal Resupply|8|Thermal [[Energy Cannons]], [[Energy Guns]], and offensive Utilities including [[Cooling Devices]], [[Coolant Injectors]], [[Energy Filters]], [[Particle Chargers]], and [[Quantum Capacitor|Quantum Capacitors]]||Trap Resupply|16|[[Traps]] and a basic [[Trap Extractor]]||Zionite Resupply|6|Zionite parts including [[Zio. Alpha Cannon]] and [[Zio. Alpha Cannon Mk. II|Mk. II]], [[Zio. Biocell]] and [[Zio. Biocell Array|Biocell Arrays]], [[Zio. Composite Leg I]], [[Zio. Composite Leg II|II]], and [[Zio. Supercomposite Leg]], [[Zio. Glidesys I]] and [[Zio. Glidesys II|II]], [[Zio. Laser-S]], [[Zio. Laser-M|M]], and [[Zio. Laser-H|H]], [[Zio. Light Carapace|Zio. Light]] and [[Zio. Heavy Carapace|Heavy]] Carapaces, [[Zio. Light DM Reactor|Zio. Light]] and [[Zio. Heavy DM Reactor|Heavy]] Reactors, [[Zio. Phaser-S]], [[Zio. Phaser-M|M]], and [[Zio. Phaser-H|H]], [[Zio. Shade Carapace]] and [[Zio. Shade Armor|Armor]], and [[Zio. Weapon Casing]][[/Table]]
[[Heading:2]]Intel hacks[[/Heading]]
Intel hacks provide Cogmind with different types of information about the current, and upcoming maps. Unlike roster hacks, intel hacks require two Terminals to use and are not instantaneous. Performing an intel hack locks the Terminal, but does not provide any information until the next Terminal is used to retrieve that intel. Retrieving intel does not lock the Terminal, however, so chaining intel retrieval with other hacks is still possible.
There are initially 4 intel hacks available per 0b10 floor. Performing intel hacks reduces the number available until there are only 2 hacks remaining. At that point, each intel hack will cause another random intel hack to become available. Unlike the fixed limit of roster hacks, intel hacks are not restricted on any given floor and are only limited by the total number of Terminals.
There are 2 categories of intel hacks: Repeatable and non-repeatable. Non-repeatable hacks can only be performed once per map. These types of hacks include map-specific intel and world map intel relating to the overall depth that certain locations occur on. Repeatable hacks can be performed an infinite number of times on any floor and tend to be longer-term types of information such as schematics and analyses. If trying to burn through intel for a specific piece of information, such as main or branch access, it is best to pick any non-repeatable hacks first. This will allow the pool of available hacks to get smaller, increasing the chances of getting the desired intel hack.
The available intel hacks are as follows:
[[Table]]Hack Name|Repatable|Effect||Active Garrisons|No|Reveals all [[Garrison (Machine)|Garrisons]] on the current map||Active Terminals|No|Reveals all Terminals on the current map||Branch Access|No|Reveals all Derelict-known [[Branch]] exits on the current map[[Sub]]1[[/Sub]]||Component Schematics|Yes|Gives 12-16 random non-Prototype [[Fabricator]] schematics||Component Stockpiles|No|Reveals locations of all non-Prototype part stockpiles on the current map||Depthwide Sectors/0|No|Reveals all Derelict-known maps on the current depth[[Sub]]1[[/Sub]]||Depthwide Sectors/-1|No|Reveals all Derelict-known maps on the next depth[[Sub]]1[[/Sub]]||Emergency Access|No|Reveals all emergency access doors on the current map||Guard Positions|No|Reveals current locations (but not types) of all [[Behemoth]], [[Heavy]], and all [[Sentry]] bots on the map||Main Access|No|Reveals all main exits on the current map||Prototype Schematics|Yes|Gives 8-12 random Prototype Fabricator schematics||Prototype Stockpiles|No|Reveals locations of all Prototype part stockpiles on the current map||Trap Installations|No|Reveals positions and types of all traps on the current map||Unaware Analyses|Yes|Gives 3 random 0b10 bot [[Robot Analysis|Analyses]]||Unaware Schematics|Yes|Gives 3 random 0b10 bot Fabricator schematics[[/Table]]
[[List:Ordered]]Derelicts are unaware of the following maps and map exits: [[Access_0]], [[Lab]], [[Section 7]], and [[Zhirov (Location)]][[/List]]
[[Redacted]][[Heading]][[Command]] Cave Seals[[/Heading]]
Imprinting has special cave seal interactions. Instead of the standard wild cave Derelicts, friendly Zionites will appear from the seal instead. These allies will be purple and uncontrollable by default. However, if a Core Reset Matrix has been consumed, all of the Z-bots will turn blue and become controllable.[[/Redacted]]

Other.Name: Intercept Squad
Other.Content:
[[Image]]Intercept Squad.png|2 Trackers and 2 Combat Programmers from Intercept squads chasing Cogmind[[/Image]]Intercept squads are [[0b10]] aligned [[Squad|squads]] that are dispatched when Cogmind gets detected and recognized in a few specific scenarios. They consist of one or more [[Tracker|Trackers]] that each summon an additional [[Combat Programmer]] upon visual contact with Cogmind. Intercept squads are dispatched depending on the number of tiles moved on a map. Once Cogmind takes enough moves, a squad will always be dispatched. Intercept squads can be Enumerated at [[Terminal|Terminals]].
An alert will indicate whenever an an Intercept squad is dispatched. Additionally, the log will display a message like [[GameText]]ALERT: Reliable intel has pinpointed LRC-V3, intercept squad en route.[[/GameText]]
[[Heading]]How to get Intercepts[[/Heading]]
Intercept squads can start being sent after Cogmind if any of the following 3 scenarios occurs:
[[List]]Cogmind uses the Data Conduit in [[Data Miner (Location)]]|[[Redacted]]Cogmind gets scanned by the lasers in [[Lab]][[/Redacted]]|[[Redacted]]Cogmind gets scanned by a [[Researcher]] in [[Section 7]][[/Redacted]][[/List]]
[[Heading]]Frequency and number[[/Heading]]
Intercept squads can have a variable number of bots depending. Initially when entering a floor, Intercepts always consist of 1-2 Trackers that summon Combat Programmers. Each further intercept has a chance of increasing the number of Trackers initially dispatched.
Intercept squads can appear at one of two timings after entering the floor. Either the squad will spawn after n (depth-dependent) tiles moved, or it will spawn in 2 times n moves. The following table shows the number of moves required for each spawn:
[[Table]]Depths|Tiles for first spawn|Tiles for second spawn||-6|500|1000||-4 and -5|400|800||-1 through -3|300|600[[/Table]]

Other.Name: Investigation Squad
Other.Content:
[[Image]]Investigation Squad.png|Two Grunts investigating a locked out Terminal[[/Image]]
Investigation squads are [[0b10]] aligned [[Squad|squads]] that are dispatched when a hostile presence is suspected in an area. They are very similar to [[Reinforcement Squad|Reinforcements]], but are triggered in slightly different scenarios, and do not stick around permanently. Investigation squads typically consist of a few [[Grunt|Grunts]] or [[Hunter|Hunters]]. Grunts are more common than Hunters in squads. They roam around the area that they were summoned to for 300-400 turns, then exit the map. Investigation squads can be both Enumerated and Recalled at [[Terminal|Terminals]].
An alert will indicate whenever an Investigation squad is dispatched. Additionally, the log will display a message like [[GameText]]ALERT: Suspicious activity at Terminal F014. Dispatching Investigation squad[[/GameText]]. Depending on the method triggering the Investigation, a different reason may be given in the alert.
[[Heading]]Lore[[/Heading]]
[[Lore]]WAR.Sys Records|Investigation Squad[[/Lore]]
[[Heading]]How to get Investigations[[/Heading]]
[[List]]Being detected using an [[Active Sensor Suite]]|Being traced at any [[Interactive Machine]], including [[Spoiler]]Force()[[/Spoiler]] hacks|Triggering an [[Alarm Trap]][[/List]]
[[Heading]]Investigation Contents[[/Heading]]
[[Table]]Depth|Grunt Squad|Hunter Squad||-10|1-2 [[G-34 Mercenary]]|N/A||-9|1-3 G-34 Mercenary|N/A||-8|2-3 [[G-47 Trooper]]|1 [[H-55 Commando]]||-7|2-3 G-47 Trooper|1-2 H-55 Commando||-6|3 [[G-50 Soldier]]|1-2 [[H-66 Slayer]]||-5|3-4 G-50 Soldier|2 H-66 Slayer||-4|3-4 [[G-67 Veteran]]|2 [[H-77 Assassin]]||-3|4 G-67 Veteran|2 H-77 Assassin||-2|4-5 [[G-73 Enforcer]]|2-3 [[H-88 Terminator]]||-1|5 G-73 Enforcer|2-3 H-88 Terminator[[/Table]]
[[Spoiler]][[Heading]][[Data Miner]] redirection[[/Heading]]
The Data Miner can redirect Investigations if his help is obtained by visiting his [[Data Miner (Location)|hideout]]. If redirected, Investigations will roam around a random area of the map rather than head to the location they were summoned to. The Data Miner has a 50% chance to direct each Investigation about 15 turns after one is dispatched. If a redirect happens, the alert [[GameText]]Higher priority target acquired, redirecting investigation.[[/GameText]] will be displayed.[[/Spoiler]]

Other.Name: Locations
Other.Content:
Locations in Cogmind are unique styles of maps to visit. The main floors (Junkyard, Materials, Factory, Research, and Access) are always located on the same depths every run. These main floors often can be visited in multiple depths. Branches, on the other hand, are typically found on only a single depth per-run and are often mutually exclusive with other branches. For example, Mines can always be found on -9, but Storage may also appear on -9, forcing a decision about which branch to take, or whether to take one at all.
The majority of maps are randomly generated, meaning no two runs or two depths will have the exact same layout. However, the overall structure of each location type is very similar. Some maps tend to be more open with large rooms and wide corridors, while others are more maze-like with tiny rooms and many small corridors leading into dead-ends. A few branches are partially or entirely static in layout and tend to be much more predictable in contents than main floors.
Branches do not progress upward toward the exit and can often be harder than the main floors. However, branches can offer unique challenges and have similarly unique rewards that can dramatically change a run. This could be powerful unique items, special events, gameplay-altering alignment, or rare permanent buffs.
The following is a list of all locations in Cogmind:
[[Locations]]

Other.Name: Patrol Squad
Other.Content:
[[Image]]Patrol Squad.png|A patrol squad of Swarmers[[/Image]]
Patrol squads are typically [[0b10]] aligned [[Squad|squads]] that patrol between points on the majority of 0b10-controlled maps, as well as [[Caves]]. They can be composed of a variety of bot types, all with slightly different patrolling behavior. Most patrol squads appear at the start of the map and will not appear over time, with the exception of [[Search Patrol|Search Patrols]]. Their presence is generally unrelated to [[Alert]]. Patrols can be Enumerated at [[Terminal|Terminals]]. Their frequency varies based on the type of map, but generally they are more common the higher up in the complex Cogmind goes.
[[Heading]]Patrol Contents[[/Heading]]
The following are the possible contents of patrol squads. At -9 and above, a [[C-30 ARC]] can also make up a single patrol squad. If it encounters a hostile, it will open up to reveal the contents of any other random patrol squad composition listed below:
[[Table]]Depth|[[Grunt]]|[[Hunter]]|[[Programmer]]|[[Swarmer]]||-10|1 [[G-47 Trooper]] squad leader and 1 [[G-34 Mercenary]]|N/A|N/A|3 [[S-10 Pest]]||-9|1 [[B-36 Bruiser]], [[L-31 Rogue]], or G-47 Trooper squad leader and 1-2 G-34 Mercenary|N/A|N/A|3-4 S-10 Pest||-8|1 B-36 Bruiser, L-31 Rogue, or [[G-50 Soldier]] and 2 G-47 Trooper|1 [[H-55 Commando]]|N/A|3-4 S-10 Pest||-7|1 [[B-48 Gladiator]], [[L-41 Fighter]], or G-50 Soldier squad leader and 2-3 G-47 Trooper|1 H-55 Commando|1 [[P-60 Hacker]]|3-4 [[S-27 Virus]]||-6|1 B-48 Gladiator, L-41 Fighter, or [[G-67 Veteran]] squad leader and 2-3 G-50 Soldier|1-2 [[H-66 Slayer]]|1 P-60 Hacker|3-4 S-27 Virus||-5|1 [[B-60 Warrior]], L-41 Fighter, or G-67 Veteran squad leader and 2-4 G-50 Soldier|1-2 H-66 Slayer|1-2 [[P-70 Sage]]|4-5 S-27 Virus||-4|1 B-60 Warrior, [[L-61 Swordsman]], or [[G-73 Enforcer]] squad leader and 2-3 G-67 Veteran|2 [[H-77 Assassin]]|1-2 P-70 Sage|4-5 S-27 Virus||-3|1 [[B-74 Champion]], L-61 Swordsman, or G-73 Enforcer squad leader and 3 G-67 Veteran|2 H-77 Assassin|1-2 [[P-80 Master]]|3-5 [[S-43 Plague]]||-2|1 B-74 Champion, L-61 Swordsman, or G-73 Enforcer squad leader and 3 G-73 Enforcer|2 [[H-88 Terminator]]|1-2 P-80 Master|4-5 S-43 Plague||-1|1 B-74 Champion, L-61 Swordsman, or G-73 Enforcer squad leader and 3-4 G-73 Enforcer|2 H-88 Terminator|1-2 P-80 Master|4-6 S-43 Plague[[/Table]]
[[Heading]]Patrol behavior[[/Heading]]
There are essentially 2 types of patrol behaviors. ARC and Hunter squads are fast patrollers, which navigate between their patrol points at max or near max speed. They quickly move in and out of areas so they can be hard to avoid if in the way, but are easier to navigate around without waiting long periods of time. Grunts, Programmers, and Swarmer squads all patrol much slower. They meander along the way and spend far more turns resting than moving forward along their route. It is easier to run away form these types of patrols if you know they are coming, but they can clog rooms or hallways for long periods of time.
[[Heading]]Frequency[[/Heading]]
[[Table]]Map|Number of patrols||-10 [[Materials]]|3||-9 Materials|5||-8 Materials|5||-7 [[Factory]]|8||-6 Factory|10||-5 Factory|12||-4 Factory|14||-3 [[Research]]|14||-2 Research|16||-1 [[Access]]|20||[[Storage]]|2||[[Extension]]|2||[[Hub_04(d)]]|2||[[Armory]]|10-18||[[Testing]]|2||[[Quarantine]]|2||[[Section 7]]|5||[[Command]]|12[[/Table]]
[[Heading]]Special patrol-summoning events[[/Heading]]
There are a few special events that can trigger patrol dispatches when already on a level.
[[Heading:2]]Search Patrols[[/Heading]]
Search Patrols are a special type of patrol that is related to Alert. These squads can be dispatched if Cogmind generates a lot of non-combat Alert. They consist of a single [[C-30 ARC]] that roam across the entire map instead of just between two points like most patrols.
[[Spoiler]][[Heading:2]][[Lightning]] squads[[/Heading]]
[[Image]]Lightning Squad.png|A Lightning squad patrolling Quarantine[[/Image]]
Lightning squads consist of 3 Lightnings and an [[I-47 Archangel]]. They can be summoned in one of two ways:
[[List]]Destroying a Hub machine in [[Hub_04(d)]]: 3 Lightning patrols will be dispatched to the map out of exits and Garrisons. They will roam in the general area of each remaining Hub.|Opening the [[Sigix Containment Pod]] chamber: A single Lighting patrol will be dispatched to the map if Cogmind breaches the Sigix chamber. It will patrol around the location of the Sigix room.[[/List]][[/Spoiler]]

Other.Name: Relay Interface Framework
Other.Content:
[[Image]]Garrison RIF Installer 1.png|RIF Installer in a Garrison[[/Image]]
Relay Interface Framework, or RIF, is one of the major [[Alignment|alignments]] available to Cogmind in a run. It helps Cogmind to have much more control over [[0b10]] bots, both combat and non-combat. RIF comes with the downside of alienating several key [[Derelict]] factions, namely turning all Derelicts at [[Zion]] and [[Warlord (Location)]] hostile when passing their associated System Quarantine Field Array machines. RIF is also incompatible with the [[Core Reset Matrix]]. If Cogmind has used a CRM then it is not possible to gain RIF. If Cogmind uses a CRM after using RIF, then RIF will be entirely erased. Similarly, if Cogmind has [[Imprint|imprinted]], then the RIF will fail to be installed.
Installing RIF can be done at any [[Garrison]] by walking into a RIF Installer machine. These machines can be hidden behind emergency accesses and Phase Walls, but there are always 1-2 installers available per map. Doing so will grant several unique abilities:
[[List]]Alert Monitor: Know the ambient influence level while in 0b10-controlled areas.
 [[Alert]] is displayed near the top right corner of the HUD, showing both the numeric influence value and the number-letter classification.|Garrison Interface: Gain control over Garrison Access machines, making it easier to hack them, and also easier to escape once inside. Also automatically detects [[Garrison (Machine)|Garrisons]] and RIF Installers up to a range of 15.
All standard (non-manual) hacks at Garrison Machines will have a 100% chance to succeed. The 15-radius detection is very handy for finding new Garrisons to enter, as well as finding hidden RIF installers behind walls.|Coupler Protocols: Use [[Relay Couplers]] to interface with their respective robots.
Use [[Datajacks]] with Relay Couplers to perform special hacks at the cost of charges on the Couplers. See [[rif.html|this page]] for the full list of hackable bots as well as unique hacks applicable to each type of bot.|Additional RIF abilities: See [[rif.html|this page]] for the full list of abilities.|Special [[Wintypes|Wintype]] interaction: [[Redacted]]If Cogmind touches the intact 0b10 Conduit machine in [[Command]] while being RIF-aligned, the W4 Assimilated 0b10 win will be achieved without needing to destroy both phases of [[MAIN.C]] as is typically required.[[/Redacted]][[/List]]

Other.Name: Revision 17 (Alignment)
Other.Content:
[[Image]]Cetus Saving Revision 17.png|Saving Revision 17 in Cetus[[/Image]]
Rescuing [[Revision 17]] in [[Cetus]] allows for a minor faction [[Alignment|alignment]]. If this is done, [[Revision 17++]] will attack [[0b10]] on the -3 [[Research]] map along with a lot of friendly [[Revision|Revisions]] as allies.This alignment is incompatible with [[Imprint|imprinting]] and Revision will flee from an imprinted Cogmind out of fear of the [[Imprinter]]. In order for the alignment to take effect, Revision 17 must survive until Cogmind exits the map, all 8 [[Cetus Guard|Cetus Guards]] must be destroyed, and the Cetus Manufacturing Module machine must be intact.
[[Heading]]-3 Research Invasion[[/Heading]]
[[Image]]Research Revisions.png|Revision 17++ with Revision allies[[/Image]]
[[Image]]Research Suppression Forces.png|Suppression forces dispatched to fight the Revisions[[/Image]]
200 turns after entering the map, Revision 17++ will lead a group of 4 Revisions to follow Cogmind. They are uncontrollable allies but do not generate any alert for Cogmind when attacking. The announcement text [[GameText]]Unknown forces entering zones 8R, 1R, 4T. Local Systems Malfunctioning[[/GameText]] will precede their coming. Squads of 4 Revisions will continue to appear from main access exits every 200 turns. Occasionally a Revision will shout [[GameText]]Recycler![[/GameText]] and turn hostile, although this may also be followed by [[GameText]]##MEMORY:RESET##[[/GameText]] to turn them friendly again. 500 turns after Revision 17 arrives, an alert [[GameText]]Research terminal network lockdown[[/GameText]] will appear, and all Terminals on the map will shut down. Another alert will show up 50 turns later: [[GameText]]Suppression forces dispatched. All non-combat units evacuate.[[/GameText]] After this message, squads of 2 [[Executioner|Executioners]] or [[Striker|Strikers]] and an [[C-30 ARC|ARC]] will start to appear from exits and roam the map, looking for hostiles. They will also spawn every 200 turns.
There are a few other side-effects of this event. One is that explosive machines will explode at random whenever Cogmind is nearby. This can be good when fighting enemies around explosive machines, but be wary of them when walking around the map or else they may surprise you at a bad time. Another is that mapgen is affected. [[Heavy|Heavies]] will not appear on a map that Revision 17 invades.
This event can be a great blessing or a curse depending on a lot of factors. Getting an escort of alert-free allies with other squads of allies roaming the map is great. They will clean up most of the map for you and can net some free prototype bot loot. Blocking Heavy spawns is incredibly useful here as well. The downsides can also be pretty major, however. Losing access to all Terminals by turn 500 can be very bad if Cogmind is on slow propulsion and has no exit intel and no form of terrain scanning. Trying to  follow the spawning Revisions or suppression forces can lead to an exit, although it can be a bit unreliable. Another downside is that the Revisions will often create a ton of squads to appear right at the beginning of the event. Sometimes, large groups of [[Operator|Operators]] and alarm traps can all be triggered at nearly the same time. This can result in massive groups of hostiles to appear right in Cogmind's face with unlucky exit or Garrison positioning.

Other.Name: Reinforcement Squad
Other.Content:
[[Image]]Reinforcement Squad.png|2 Hunters in a reinforcement squad[[/Image]]
Reinforcement squads are [[0b10]] aligned [[Squad|squads]] that are dispatched when a hostile presence is reported in an area. They are similar to [[Investigation Squad|Investigations]], but are triggered in slightly different scenarios, and typically stick around permanently. Reinforcement squads typically consist of a few [[Grunt|Grunts]] or [[Hunter|Hunters]]. [[Heavy|Heavies]] can call unique types of reinforcements that do not stick around forever and are made up of [[Cutter|Cutters]] or [[Specialist|Specialists]]. Reinforcements will roam around the area that they were summoned to permanently. They can be both Enumerated and Recalled at [[Terminal|Terminals]].
An alert will indicate whenever a Reinforcement squad is dispatched. Additionally, the log will display a message like [[GameText]]ALERT: Hostiles spotted, dispatching reinforcements to Terminal F003.[[/GameText]] Depending on the method triggering the reinforcement, a different reason my be given in the alert.
[[Heading]]Lore[[/Heading]]
[[Lore]]WAR.Sys Records|Reinforcement Squad[[/Lore]]
[[Heading]]How to get Reinforcements[[/Heading]]
[[List]]Being detected by a Heavy on their [[Active Sensor Suite]]|Being reported by a [[Hauler]] carrying [[Prototype Part|Prototypes]] that is attacked|Being reported by an [[Operator]] at their associated Terminal|Being reported by a [[Researcher]] that witnesses Cogmind fire a weapon in their presence|Being reported by a [[U-05 Engineer]] that is being attacked while trying to perform repairs[[/List]]
[[Heading]]Reinforcement Contents[[/Heading]]
[[Table]]Depth|Grunt Squad|Hunter Squad|Heavy Cutter squad|Heavy Specialist squad||-10|1-2 [[G-34 Mercenary]]|N/A|N/A|N/A||-9|1-2 G-34 Mercenary|N/A|N/A|N/A||-8|2-3 [[G-47 Trooper]]|N/A|2-4 [[C-17 Slicer]]|2 [[X-57 Shotgunner]] or [[X-62 Marksman]]||-7|2-3 G-47 Trooper|N/A|2-4 C-17 Slicer|2 X-57 Shotgunner, X-62 Marksman, or [[X-67 Chaingunner]]||-6|2-3 [[G-50 Soldier]]|1-2 [[H-66 Slayer]]|2-4 C-17 Slicer|2 X-62 Marksman, X-67 Chaingunner, or [[X-72 Disruptor]]||-5|2-3 G-50 Soldier|1-2 H-66 Slayer|2-4 [[C-35 Carver]]|2 X-67 Chaingunner, X-72 Disruptor, or [[X-77 Beamer]]||-4|3-4 [[G-67 Veteran]]|2 [[H-77 Assassin]]|2-4 C-35 Carver|2 X-72 Disruptor, X-77 Beamer, or [[X-82 Rainmaker]]||-3|3-4 G-67 Veteran|2 H-77 Assassin|2-4 C-35 Carver|2 X-77 Beamer, X-82 Rainmaker, or [[X-87 Electro]]||-2|3-4 [[G-73 Enforcer]]|2-3 [[H-88 Terminator]]|2-4 [[C-57 Dissector]]|2 X-82 Rainmaker or X-87 Electro||-1|3-4 G-73 Enforcer|2-3 H-88 Terminator|2-4 C-57 Dissector|2 X-87 Electro[[/Table]]
[[Heading]]Heavy reinforcements[[/Heading]]
[[Image]]Heavy Reinforcement Squad.png|A Heavy and summoned Specialist reinforcements[[/Image]]
Heavy-summoned reinforcements behave differently than other reinforcements. These reinforcements only stick around for about 150 turns before returning back to a nearby exit as opposed to staying permanently. Heavy reinforcement contents also depend on Cogmind's speed. If Cogmind is on a fast airborne propulsion type like hover or flight, Cutters will be dispatched far more frequently than Specialists. For all slower grounded propulsion types, Specialists are the most common summon type.
Heavy reinforcements are called more frequently if Cogmind is actively moving. If trying to avoid reinforcements, Cogmind should quickly exit the Heavy's sensor radius rather than spend turns moving inside the radius. If the Heavy is on a [[Security Rotation]] and currently moving, it may be a good idea to stand still until the Heavy has moved away to try to avoid reinforcements rather than to continue moving in detection range.

Other.Name: Search Patrol
Other.Content: Search patrols are a unique type of [[0b10]] aligned [[Patrol Squad|patrol squad]]. They can be dispatched if Cogmind generates a lot of [[Alert]] from non-combat sources. This is primarily caused by being spotted by [[Watcher|Watchers]] or guard bots like [[Sentry|Sentries]], or by being spotted by any combat hostile and then running away and losing tracking. If the Alert level is above the typical [[Assault Squad|Assault]] range of level 2/400 influence and Cogmind has gained the majority of the influence from these non-combat sources, there is a chance that one or more search patrols may be dispatched. If a search patrol is announced, influence will drop by 150. This will be accompanied by the alert [[GameText]]ALERT: Heightened foreign activity detected, dispatching search patrol.[[/GameText]] The alert will also indicate if multiple search patrols are to be sent out simultaneously. One or more ARCs will be dispatched after a few more turns. These ARCs behave similarly as regular patrol ARCs and have the same standard patrol contents within them. However, search squads will choose random points on the map to patrol to rather than having a fixed patrol route like all other patrols.

Other.Name: Security Squad
Other.Content:
[[Image]]Security Squad Heavy.png|A Heavy guarding a busy intersection[[/Image]]
Security squads are [[0b10]] aligned [[Squad|squads]] that guard a single location and do not move unless alerted to hostiles. While they are called squads, security bots nearly always work alone and do not come in groups. Security bots tend to be guarding busy exits, corridors, [[Interactive Machine|interactive machines]], and part stockpiles. These squads are primary composed of [[Behemoth|Behemoths]], [[Heavy|Heavies]], and [[Sentry|Sentries]]. They tend to be present on the map when Cogmind enters, and don't appear in greater numbers as time goes on. The main exception to this is Heavies, which may be replenished by the [[Security Rotation]] event, although there will typically never be more than the initial number of Heavies on a map. Security squads can be Enumerated at [[Terminal|Terminals]], but only within a very limited radius of 20 tiles.
[[Heading]]Security Contents[[/Heading]]
[[Table]]Depth|Behemoth|Heavy|Sentry||-10|N/A|N/A|N/A||-9|N/A|N/A|[[Y-45 Defender]]||-8|N/A|[[H-61 Shepherd]]|Y-45 Defender||-7|N/A|H-61 Shepherd|[[Y-54 Guardian]]||-6|[[B-75 Beast]]|H-61 Shepherd|Y-54 Guardian||-5|B-75 Beast|[[H-71 Marshal]]|[[Y-64 Sentinel]]||-4|[[B-86 Titan]]|H-71 Marshal|Y-64 Sentinel||-3|B-86 Titan|H-71 Marshal|[[Y-72 Warden]]||-2|[[B-90 Cyclops]]|[[H-81 Overseer]]|Y-72 Warden||-1|[[B-99 Colossus]]|H-81 Overseer|Y-72 Warden[[/Table]]
[[Heading]]Special security-summoning events[[/Heading]]
There are a few events that may trigger additional security guards to spawn on the map.
[[Heading:2]][[Cargo Convoy]] interruption[[/Heading]]
100 turns after a Cargo Convoy is disrupted, Heavies will begin to appear at 0b10-controlled exits and [[Garrison (Machine)|Garrisons]]. Every further 100 turns that pass, another Heavy will enter the map and head toward a nearby exit.
[[Heading:2]][[High Security|High]] or [[Maximum Security]][[/Heading]]
About 80 turns after entering High or Maximum Security, 4 Sentries will spawn from all Garrisons and 0b10-controlled exits.
[[Spoiler]][[Heading:2]][[Quarantine]] Cryocooling Duct failure[[/Heading]]
[[Image]]Quarantine Guards.png|Quarantine Guards dispatched from a Garrison[[/Image]]
Cryocooling Duct machines may be sometimes found in Quarantine. These machines the ambient temperature of the map by default, but if 2 are destroyed, the ambient heat will rise up to +20. If this happens, all combat bots will be withdrawn from the map, and 12 [[Quarantine Guard|Quarantine Guards]] will be dispatched after about 100 turns. These bots will guard various high traffic parts of the map, while others patrol the map. A few will guard exits, as well as a Garrison, if one is present.[[/Spoiler]]

Other.Name: Squad
Other.Content:
Squads are groups of one or more robots that work together as a single group. The majority of the squads in the game are [[0b10]]-aligned and thus hostile to Cogmind, but there are also [[Derelict]] squads that can be either friendly or hostile to Cogmind depending on the circumstances. Some 0b10 squad types can be recalled using a low success rate Recall hack at a [[Terminal]], but all squad types can be located using an Enumerate hack. The numbers of all squad types, although not their compositions or locations, can be revealed with the Enumerate(Squads) hack.
Typically, one bot per squad is designated as the [[Squad Leader]]. Squad leaders are the only bots that have the AI or order type active. All other bots are set to follow the squad leader. If the squad leader is destroyed, the other bots in the squad will either end up wandering around randomly, or leaving the map if their squad leader was already leaving the map.
[[Heading]]Types of 0b10 Squads[[/Heading]]
[[List]][[Assault Squad]] - Dispatched by 0b10 to target Cogmind directly. Unlike most squads that walk to their target, all Assault contents are contained with a faster wheeled [[C-30 ARC]]. Only get dispatched if Cogmind has [[Alert]] level 2 or higher (400 influence).|[[Coupling Squad]] - Dispatched periodically by 0b10 on any floors where [[Garrison (Machine)|Garrisons]] are available. Consist of a single [[Programmer]] carrying multiple [[Relay Couplers]] to restock a Garrison.|[[Demolisher Squad]] - Dispatched by 0b10 to eliminate large groups of hostiles, particularly [[Assembled]].|[[Extermination Squad]] - Dispatched periodically by 0b10 in [[Factory]] and beyond. They consist entirely of Programmers and will always head directly to Cogmind.|[[Garrison Squad]] - Dispatched by 0b10 Garrisons when combat occurs near that Garrison. Bots will roam around the area where the attack occurred, then return after 200-300 turns.|[[Spoiler]][[Intercept Squad]] - Dispatched by 0b10 directly to Cogmind only in a few special circumstances. Intercept squads consist of powerful [[Prototype Robot|Prototype]] bots designed to quickly neutralize Cogmind.[[/Spoiler]]|[[Investigation Squad]] - Dispatched by 0b10 to investigate an area of interest for 300-400 turns, then they exit the level.|[[Patrol Squad]] - Patrol between two points of interest at varying speeds. Unlike most other squads, patrols only appear at the beginning of a map, and more will not be replenished.|[[Reinforcement Squad]] - Dispatched by 0b10 to permanently reinforce an area of interest. Similar to investigations but do not leave their post and will patrol around the area they are summoned to forever.|[[Security Squad]] - Stand guard at intersections, on top of exits, and in rooms with part stockpiles or Machines. Will typically not move unless they are alerted of a hostile.|[[Surveillance Squad]] - Patrol between two points of interest similar to a Patrol squad, but made up of a single [[Watcher]] instead of combat bots.|[[Transport Squad]] - [[Hauler]] guarded by 0-2 [[Grunt|Grunts]] that transport parts from place to place. Empty Haulers may pick up parts fabricated at a [[Fabricator]].[[/List]]

Other.Name: Surveillance Squad
Other.Content:
[[Image]]Surveillance Squad.png|A Watcher surveillance squad[[/Image]]
Surveillance squads are [[0b10]] aligned [[Squad|squads]] that roam the map looking for hostiles to report to 0b10 combat bots. They consist only of a single [[Watcher]]. This is a [[W-16 Scout]] on -10 and -9, a [[W-25 Informer]] on -8 through -5, and a [[W-44 Eye]] on -4 through -1. They can be Enumerated at [[Terminal|Terminals]]. They patrol between two points at a slow pace, then turn back around when they reach the end. The [[Garrison (Machine)]] hack [[Spoiler]]Trojan(Watchers)[[/Spoiler]] reports where all Watchers are at all times.

Other.Name: Transport Squad
Other.Content:
[[Image]]Transport Squad.png|A Hauler guarded by 2 Grunts[[/Image]]
Transport squads are [[0b10]] aligned [[Squad|squads]] that carry parts from one location to another and can be found on most 0b10 controlled maps. They typically consist of a single [[Hauler]] and 0-2 guard [[Grunt|Grunts]] that escort them. Haulers that are guarded have [[Prototype Part|prototypes]] inside them, but some unguarded Haulers may still have prototype parts. If a Hauler that carries prototype parts is attacked, they will summon a [[Reinforcement Squad]] to their location on depths -7 and higher. Typical transport squads all start on the map, and more of them do not appear if destroyed. Transport squads can be Enumerated at [[Terminal|Terminals]], and a [[Transport Network Coupler]] or [[Modified TNC]] will reveal their current positions. The Modified TNC will also show the contents of all Haulers. Similarly, the Manifests hack shows all of the contents of all Haulers on the map, as well as any associated guards. This can be useful to determine that certain guarded/unguarded Haulers are worthwhile to try to loot. The 
[[Heading]]Transport Contents[[/Heading]]

[[Heading]][[Cargo Convoy]][[/Heading]]
[[Image]]Cargo Convoy.png[[/Image]]
Cargo Convoys are a unique type of transport squad that appear in main [[Factory]] and [[Research]] maps. They are much more heavily guarded than typical Transport squads, but the parts they carry are also much higher rating than usual. If attacked, they will trigger a special response where [[Heavy|Heavies]] guard all of the exits on the map.

Other.Name: Warlord (Alignment)
Other.Content:
Aligning with [[Warlord]] is one of the major faction [[Alignment|alignments]] available to Cogmind in a run and can be done in his [[Warlord (Location)|Base]] in either -5 or -4 [[Upper Caves]]. Aligning with Warlord has effects on 2 major events later in the game. It triggers an event where Warlord, [[God Mode]], and friendly [[Derelict|Derelicts]] assault -2 [[Research]]. It also has a lategame effect in [[Command]]: [[Redacted]]When opening the Command seals, [[Warlord (Command)]] will appear along with a group of other friendly Derelicts.[[/Redacted]]
One Warlord alignment-related item is the [[Encrypted Comm Array]]. If Cogmind either compromises [[Garrison|Garrison]] or [[Sterilization|sterilizes]] [[DSF|DSFs]], Cogmind can recieve the Comm Array and learn the depth of Warlord's base. If enough assistance is provided, a force multiplier can provide allies during the -2 assault and in the [[Redacted]]Command Seals[[/Redacted]].
[[Heading]]-2 Research Assault[[/Heading]]
The event will begin with the alert [[GameText]]ALERT: Engineering response network critical failure, offline[[/GameText]]. More announcements will show up, but the next most important one will be [[GameText]]Warlord currently on norther/central/southern western approach. All units hit designated targets[[/GameText]] which indicates where Warlord and [[God Mode]] will appear on the map. 50 turns after entering the map, another announcement [[GameText]]Trap arrays successfully disabled[[/GameText]] will come with all traps being removed from the map. 110 after entering the maps, [[GameText]]Machine network successfully disabled[[/GameText]] will indicate that every machine on the map is now shut down except for [[Garrison (Machine)|Garrisons]] due to the follow-up message [[GameText]]Unrecognized interference restored Garrison access controls. Oops. Just blast them.[[/GameText]] 250 turns after entering the map and every 150 turns after that, 3 different assault squad spawns will appear from Garrisons and map exits with the message [[GameText]]Unaware assault squad dispatched in northeast/southeast/southwest/northwest quadrant.[[/GameText]] The spawn location will be indicated on the map. Every 100 turns 1 Derelict squad will spawn on the left side of the map for each tunnel. After 1000 turns on the map, Warlord will tell Cogmind that it is time to retreat and to open the [[Redacted]]Cave Seals in [[Command]] for the final push.[[/Redacted]]
[[Image]]Research Warlord Squads.png|A few Derelict squads[[/Image]]
The Derelict forces consist of many unique bots during this event. All of them appear as non-controllable allies that do not generate any alert for Cogmind. There are 3 spawn points in the form of giant tunnels. Each tunnel is dug out by a [[Borebot]] escorted by 2 [[Samaritan|Samaritans]]. They will dig straight across the map to the right side. Tiles that are dug out by Borebots are safe to travel on and will not cave-in. Warlord attack squads can vary greatly in composition but are made up of the following bots:
[[List]][[Butcher (7)|Butchers]]|[[Commander|Commanders]]|[[Dragon|Dragons]]|[[Fireman (7)|Firemen]]|[[Guerrilla (7)|Guerrillas]]|[[Hydra|Hydras]]|[[Knight]]|[[Marauder (8)|Marauders]]|[[Martyr (7)|Martyrs]]|[[Savage (7)|Savages]]|[[Thug (7)|Thugs]]|[[Troll|Trolls]]|[[Wasp (7)|Wasps]]|[[Wizard (7)|Wizards]][[/List]]
[[Image]]Research Warlord Assault Squads.png|0b10 Warlord response assault squad[[/Image]]The 0b10 forces come in groups of 3 bots. There are always 2 (not necessarily of the same type) of [[Executioner]], [[Striker]], and [[D-83 Annihilator]] bots along with a [[C-30 ARC|ARC]] full of bots. They roam around the map looking for bots to fight.
If Cogmind has aided Warlord forces by compromising Garrisons and DSFs, Cogmind may get 1 or 2 additional special escort squads based on the force multplier. These special squads will head straight to Cogmind's location and follow. The higher the force multiplier, the stronger the squads available for escort. The special squads are as follows:
[[List]]Bridgeowners Association: Trolls|Cat Herders: Wasps|Death Star: Martyrs|Department No. 42: Firemen|Offensive Angels: Wasps|Golden Rifles: Commanders, Geurrillas, Surgeons, and Thugs|Grunt Murderers: Thugs|Gunslingers: Guerrillas|Lair Dwellers: Hydras|Lobotomizers: Wizards|Lucky Slug: Marauders|Magnificant Bastards: Mutants|Metalheads: Mutants|Knights of the Pentagonal Table: Knights|Railsplitters: Guerrillas|Shockpunchers: Wizards|Smaug Morners: Dragons|The Professionals: Commanders, Guerrillas, Knights, Surgeons, Trolls, and Wizards|Vikings: Butchers|Viscera Detail: Butchers and Savages[[/List]]
This event tends to be great for Cogmind. The primary downsides is that the machine network turns off relatively early into the event and locating the desired exit can be a pain. Getting stuck in a bad position without any Derelict allies can also be painful since the assaults, particularly the prototype bots and demolishers, pack quite a punch. However, the large number of alert-free allies and free loot from the bots fighting is great to any build. Like the Revision 17 event, this event will also cause the maps to have no Heavies. Finding any exit is usually possible by following the assault dispatch notifications. Assaults will be dispatched out of any Garrison or exit. The only exits that assaults do not come from are Quarantine prefab exits. In that case, using other infowar like terrain scanning and drones is the best way to locate these exits.

Other.Name: Wintypes
Other.Content:
W0 "Escaped": Take a [[Surface]] exit on -1.
W1 [[Redacted]]"Establishing 0b11": Take a Surface exit on -1 after destroying both phases of [[MAIN.C]].[[/Redacted]]
W2 [[Spoiler]]Heading to fleet: Take a surface exit on -1 after using a [[Core Reset Matrix]].[[/Spoiler]]
W3 [[Spoiler]]Destroyed 0b10: Take a Surface exit on -1 while carrying the [[Sigix Containment Pod]] in inventory. [[Redacted]]May also be performed by taking the exit with the [[Sigix Warrior]].[[/Redacted]][[/Spoiler]]
W4 [[Redacted]]Assimilated 0b10: Stand next to the unbroken 0b10 Conduit machine in MAIN.C's room in [[Command]] after either killing both forms of MAIN.C or with [[RIF]].[[/Redacted]]
W5 [[Redacted]]Destroyed Tau Ceti IV: In [[Access_0]], obtain the [[A2 Data Core]] by killing [[A2]] and perform Gate Tests 138-A and 138-B once, then test 138-C twice on the Gate Controls terminal with an intact Singularity Gate machine.[[/Redacted]]
W6 [[Redacted]]Escaped singularity: In Access_0, destroy all 4 Subspace Access Nodes, destroy the Architect, and take the surface exit within 10 turns.[[/Redacted]]
W7 [[Redacted]]Establishing Free Derelict Territories: In Command, destroy both forms of MAIN.C with [[Warlord]] still alive and not shut down.[[/Redacted]]
W8 [[Redacted]]Fortifying 0b10: Choose the Surrender option after destroying MAIN.C's outer shell, then destroy enough [[Enhanced Q-Series]] while keeping MAIN.C alive.[[/Redacted]]

Other.Name: Zhirov (Alignment)
Other.Content:
[[Image]]Testing SGEMP.png|The SGEMP room in Testing[[/Image]]
Aligning with [[Zhirov]] is a minor [[Alignment|alignment]] that can be started in [[Zhirov (Location)|Zhirov's Lab]]. After entering and exiting the Terminal room on the left side of the map, Zhirov will ask Cogmind to steal the [[SGEMP Prototype]] from [[Testing]] and bring it to [[Access]]. If this is done, Zhirov, Perun, and Svarog will show up in Access and give Cogmind full map intel. They will follow Cogmind but will all teleport out if Zhirov falls below roughly half core integrity. They also leave if Cogmind enters [[Command]]. If a [[Core Reset Matrix]] is used prior to Access but Cogmind still carries the SGEMP, Zhirov and his allies will turn hostile and fight Cogmind to the death
There is a second part of this quest that continues in [[Command]]. [[Redacted]][[Image]]ModifiedSGEMP.gif|Zhirov detonating the modified SGEMP in Command, disabling MAIN.C[[/Image]]
After destroying the first form of [[MAIN.C (Shell)|MAIN.C]] in Command, Zhirov, Perun, and Svarog will show up and attack MAIN.C. Zhirov will activate the Modified SGEMP and disable all 0b10-aligned bots on the map. This also affects [[Warlord (Command)]], but no other Derelicts. This does stop Cogmind from getting the score bonuses of defeating [[MAIN.C]], as well as the + on the scoresheet.[[/Redacted]]
